alert.note: Alert for Evans; Inland Liberty; Long; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 7:59PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EVANS, LIBERTY, LONG AND TATTNALL COUNTIES... At 759 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Mendes, or 8 miles west of Glennville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Reidsville, Glennville, Claxton, Hagan, Daisy, Bellville, Manassas and Mendes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Excessive cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 15 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
